info.title: messages API
info.description: This is the messages API schema.

get.description:
Download binary data for the specified blob ID.

This endpoint returns the raw binary content of a blob. Access is controlled
by checking if the user has access to any mailbox that owns this blob.

post.description:
Upload binary data and create a Blob record.
        This endpoint accepts multipart/form-data containing a file and returns a
        blob ID and other metadata. The blob is associated with the specified mailbox.

parameters.name: mailbox_id
parameters.description: ID of the mailbox to associate the blob with

403.description: Forbidden - User does not have permission to upload to this mailbox

get.description: Return a dictionary of public settings for the frontend to consume.

DRIVE.description: The URLs of the Drive external service.

200.description: A dictionary of public configuration settings.

get.description:
List contacts with optional filtering by mailbox and search query.

Query parameters:
- mailbox_id: Optional UUID to filter contacts by mailbox
- q: Optional search query for name or email (case insensitive)

parameters.name: mailbox_id
parameters.description: Filter contacts by mailbox ID.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search contacts by name or email (case insensitive).

get.description: ViewSet for Contact model.

post.description:
Create or update a draft message.
    
    This endpoint allows you to:
    - Create a new draft message in a new thread
    - Create a draft reply to an existing message in an existing thread
    - Update an existing draft message
    
    For creating a new draft:
    - Do not include messageId
    - Include parentId if replying to an existing message
    
    For updating an existing draft:
    - Include messageId of the draft to update
    - Only the fields that are provided will be updated
    
    At least one of draftBody must be provided.
    
    To add attachments, upload them first using the /api/v1.0/blob/upload/{mailbox_id}/ endpoint
    and include the returned blobIds in the attachmentIds field.

put.description:
Create or update a draft message.
    
    This endpoint allows you to:
    - Create a new draft message in a new thread
    - Create a draft reply to an existing message in an existing thread
    - Update an existing draft message
    
    For creating a new draft:
    - Do not include messageId
    - Include parentId if replying to an existing message
    
    For updating an existing draft:
    - Include messageId of the draft to update
    - Only the fields that are provided will be updated
    
    At least one of draftBody must be provided.
    
    To add attachments, upload them first using the /api/v1.0/blob/upload/{mailbox_id}/ endpoint
    and include the returned blobIds in the attachmentIds field.

post.description: Change a specific flag (unread, starred, trashed) for multiple messages or all messages within multiple threads. Uses request body.

Import messages by uploading an EML or MBOX file.
        
        The import is processed asynchronously and returns a task ID for tracking.
        The file must be a valid EML or MBOX format. The recipient mailbox must exist
        and the user must have access to it.

task_id.description: Task ID for tracking the import

202.description: Import started. Returns Celery task ID for tracking.

400.description: Invalid input data or file format

403.description: User does not have access to the specified mailbox

post.description:
Import messages from an IMAP server.
        
        This endpoint initiates an asynchronous import process from an IMAP server.
        The import is processed in the background and returns a task ID for tracking.
        
        Required parameters:
        - imap_server: Hostname of the IMAP server
        - imap_port: Port number for the IMAP server
        - username: IMAP account username
        - password: IMAP account password
        - recipient: ID of the mailbox to import messages into
        
        Optional parameters:
        - use_ssl: Whether to use SSL for the connection (default: true)

task_id.description: Task ID for tracking the import

202.description: IMAP import started. Returns Celery task ID for tracking the import progress.

400.description: Invalid input data or IMAP connection parameters

403.description: User does not have access to the specified mailbox or IMAP credentials are invalid

get.description:
List all labels accessible to the user in a hierarchical structure.

        The response returns labels in a tree structure where:
        - Labels are ordered alphabetically by name
        - Each label includes its children (sub-labels)
        - The hierarchy is determined by the label's name (e.g., "Inbox/Important" is a child of "Inbox")

        You can filter labels by mailbox using the mailbox_id query parameter.

parameters.name: mailbox_id
parameters.description: Filter labels by mailbox ID. If not provided, returns labels from all accessible mailboxes.

200.description: List of labels in hierarchical structure

schema.detail: You need EDITOR, SENDER or ADMIN role to manage labels
You need EDITOR, SENDER or ADMIN role to manage labels
You need EDITOR, SENDER or ADMIN role to manage labels

thread_ids.description: List of thread IDs to add to this label

schema.detail: You need EDITOR, SENDER or ADMIN role to manage labels

thread_ids.description: List of thread IDs to remove from this label

schema.detail: You need EDITOR, SENDER or ADMIN role to manage labels

get.description: ViewSet for Mailbox model.

ViewSet for managing MailboxAccess records for a specific Mailbox.
The mailbox_id is expected as part of the URL.
Access is allowed if the user has MailboxAccess (ADMIN role)
to the target Mailbox itself, or is a domain admin of the mailbox's domain.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

get.description:
ViewSet for listing MailDomains the user administers.
Provides a top-level entry for mail domain administration.
Endpoint: /maildomains/

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

get.description:
ViewSet for managing Mailboxes within a specific MailDomain.
Nested under /maildomains/{maildomain_pk}/mailboxes/
Permissions are checked by IsMailDomainAdmin for the maildomain_pk.

This viewset serves a different purpose than the one in mailbox.py (/api/v1.0/mailboxes/).
That other one is for listing the mailboxes a user has access to in regular app use.
This one is for managing mailboxes within a specific maildomain in the admin interface.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

post.description: Create new mailbox in a specific maildomain.

200.description: The new mailbox with one extra field `one_time_password` if identity provider is keycloak.

post.description: Check if recipient email addresses exist for the MTA.
Handle incoming raw email (message/rfc822) from MTA.

Send a previously created draft message.

    This endpoint finalizes and sends a message previously saved as a draft.
    The message content (subject, body, recipients) should be set when creating/updating the draft.
    Returns a task ID that can be used to track the sending status.

get.description:
Get the status of an async task.

    This endpoint returns the current status of a task identified by its ID.
List threads with optional search functionality.

get.description: Get aggregated statistics for threads based on filters.

parameters.name: has_attachments
parameters.description: Filter threads with attachments (1=true, 0=false).

parameters.name: has_draft
parameters.description: Filter threads with draft messages (1=true, 0=false).

parameters.name: has_sender
parameters.description: Filter threads with messages sent by the user (1=true, 0=false).

parameters.name: has_starred
parameters.description: Filter threads with starred messages (1=true, 0=false).

parameters.name: has_trashed
parameters.description: Filter threads that are trashed (1=true, 0=false).

parameters.name: label_slug
parameters.description: Filter threads by label slug.

parameters.name: mailbox_id
parameters.description: Filter threads by mailbox ID.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search threads by content (subject, sender, recipients, message body).

parameters.name: stats_fields
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of fields to aggregate.
                Special values: 'all' (count all threads), 'all_unread' (count all unread threads).
                Boolean fields: has_trashed, has_draft, has_starred, has_attachments, has_sender, has_active, is_spam, has_messages.
                Unread variants ('_unread' suffix): count threads where the condition is true AND the thread is unread.
                Examples: 'all,all_unread', 'has_starred,has_starred_unread', 'is_spam,is_spam_unread'

200.description: A dictionary containing the aggregated counts. Keys correspond to the fields requested via the `stats_fields` query parameter. Each value is an integer count. Keys not requested will not be present in the response.

400.description: Returned if `stats_fields` parameter is missing or contains invalid fields.
